1.content: What gender would you like your character to be?
1.title: Gender

choices: Slow down time for everyone but you!
Shoot laser beams from your hands!
Make people see and hear things that aren't really there!
11.content: You know how this goes. You got bitten by a radioactive dog/were splashed when a tanker full of mysterious and volatile chemicals crashed/ate a bad enchilada at Joe's Discount Mexican Food. The next day, you discovered that you could...
11.title: A Freak Accident!

111.content:
You live in a world of sleepy warmth. It is a good place, a happy place. But you know that your little world is doomed. Every morning, at about this time-
          "Time to wake up!"
          The light in your room turns on. You groan. Your idiot brother yells, runs over to your bed and yanks off your covers. He waits about 3 seconds for you to get up, then (just like every morning) leaps up into the air with his right elbow lowered. Every day from up till now he has landed elbow first right in the middle of your stomach (or back, if you slept chest-down). Today, things turned out a little differently. You wait for the familiar impact. You wait some more. Finally, you open your eyes to see what went wrong.
          Your little brother is floating above you! You quickly roll out of bed, and examine this strange situation further. There he is, just hanging in mid-air. He has his elbow lowered, and his legs back - perfect elbow-drop form. The only problem is that he is falling very slowly. VERY slowly. You look around, confused. You wave your hand above him, feeling for strings or something. Nothing.
          You walk into the kitchen to get your mom's opinion on this. What?! Your mom is standing at the stove, holding her spatula up. A pancake is suspended about 3 feet above the spatula. As you watch, it slowly spins and descends back towards the stove.
          You walk back into your room to think about this. You see that your brother is now about half a foot above your bed, and is still slowly descending towards it. You concentrate, and suddenly he falls to the bed at normal speed.
KER-WUMP!
          Your brother lands on the bed. He lays there for a moment, then sits up and looks at you with a confused look on his face.
          "How did you move so fast?"
          "Didn't you know, twerp? I've been training to be a ninja!" you smile and reply.
          He looks at you for a second, then shakes his head and walks into the kitchen. You follow him.
          You eat breakfast and get ready for school. On the way, you decide to experiment a little. You find out how to control your new power. You can slow down time a little, or you can slow it down a lot. You try to speed time up, but it doesn't work.
          You get to school plenty early (by slowing down time, you turned a 15 minute walk into a 2 minute one). You are still thinking about all this when you bump into someone in the hallway. Oops. Guess you should have paid more attention where you were going.
          "Hey, dweeb! You trying to start something?!"
          Groan. It's Bruno. He's a bully and a jerk. About once a week, he finds some reason to beat you up. You just gave him one for this week.
          You try to apologize, but Bruno's not listening. He pulls back his fist to hit you.
111.title: Slow-Mo

1111.content:
You concentrate, and suddenly everything slows down. You calmly sidestep Bruno's punch, then bend down and tie his shoelaces together. Then you relax, and time goes back to normal.
         BANG!
         "Oww!"
         Bruno misses you and punches a locker instead. He cradles his hand, looks at you, then turns and tries to run away. For some mysterious reason (wink, wink) he has difficulty doing so, and ends up facedown on the floor. Everyone laughs at him.
         "I'll get you for this! You're gonna pay!"
         Bruno tries to get up, fails, and crawls away in shame.
         The rest of the day goes by without incident. You go home and go to sleep.
         The next morning, you notice that your brother doesn't go through his normal routine. He just quietly knocks on your door and whispers "It's time to get up," then walks away.
          You get to school and go to your locker. From quite a ways away, you can tell that something isn't right. When you get closer, you find out what it is: someone scratched a bunch of words on your locker door:
         This locker belongs to a loser.
         I play with Barbies.
         I am a jerk.
         And so on. As you stand there reading these insults, you hear a voice behind you.
         "You like it? I did it to repay you for yesterday."
1111.title: Strike three! You're OUT!

choices: Why did I recieve my powers?
11111.content:
Furious, and red eyes you turn to the transgressor. Ready to use powers, you narrow in on him, and slow time.

Strange.

Nothing is moving. You've never actually STOPPED time before. It doesn’t feel like your doing. But Bruno is standing there with a stupid grin on his face. Nothing is moving.

"Wow." you say to yourself. You are getting better at this.

"Indeed."

Startled you jump high in to the air, and look to see whom it is. A gray-hared man, dressed in a pitch-black suit, looks to you smirking. Clean cut, he reminds you of an older James Bond, cufflinks and all.

"I see you have found your powers."

You say nothing but stare unblinking at the older man.

"And you are using it for good." He said sarcastically.

"Look ma..an. I don't know who.." you stutter.

“And I’m sure Bruno is going to get beat once more.”

“Waaa…”

“And then who’s next?”

“LISTEN!” you scream. “I’m DEFENDING myself.

He shakes his head and smiles.

"You receive powers, and you don't even question them. But when some one reminds you that you are now the Bully, you get all defensive."

You stand stunned not knowing what to say.

"He was bullying me."

"I saw your eyes."

"But...."

"Have you asked your self why you haven't questioned receiving powers."

You realize you really haven't. It feels natural, almost like a hand that you never noticed.

"Exactly" the gray haired man says.

"But what..."

The gray haired man walks to you, and looks directly in to your eyes. You see lightning flash in his hazel pool. Frightened you take a step back.

"One question I'll answer." He says.

Who is he?

Why did I receive my powers?

What to ask?!
11111.title: You ask

111111.content:
"I am the time keeper of eternal life." he explains. "I protect the timegate and the time key. Every so often I pick a child to place my gift on so he can defend earth realm against the time eaters - they are evil warriors who seek to destroy time, which will cause a chain reaction making all time come into one time... eventually destroying the earth."
         You stare at him, mouth hanging open. He continues.
         "I am about to give you the time key to look after until you have to pass it onto the next warrior to protect time. They will come for you and you must defend yourself and the key. You must never let them get the key! Get on with your life for now and don't tell anyone about your gift...."
         There is a blinding flash of light. You back away and hold your hand up to shield your eyes. When you recover, the man is gone.
         "Wait a minute! I thought you were going to give me some sort of key!" you call out. No response comes.
         "Well, that's just great!" you mutter as you shove your hands in your pockets. "I'm supposed to protect some stupid key and I don't even have-" you stop midsentence as you feel a metal object in your left pocket. Pulling it out, you see that it is a golden key with a bright blue stone embedded in the end of it. It has the word "TIME" engraved on both sides of it.
111111.title: A Timely Choice

choices: Skip to when you get home.
Have the story go to the next class.
1111111.content: You quickly place the key back in your pocket. You're not too excited about this whole mess, but your gut instinct tells you that this is serious. As you walk towards your class, you think you heard something slither past you. Just your imagination, perhaps?
1111111.title: Keeping the Key.

11111112.content:
Math is your next class. You just aren't good at math at all. When you walk in through the door, the teacher hands you a sheet of paper. "Pop quiz," she manages a weak smile.

Oh no! you think. A pop quiz? I don't even know what this chapter is about... You see look to the side as something moves in the corner of your vision. No, it wasn't your imagination... A snake is slithering slowly on the floor. No one else seems to notice.

"Ah-hem," the teacher says, making you jump. "You can get to your seat and do your quiz now..."

The snake has stopped moving, but is staring at you. "Can you...?" you start to say, but you notice the rest of the class is just staring at you, so you just sit down.

The quiz...you haven't even looked at the chapter yet. You're going to fail it; unless...
11111112.title: The Snake Slithers in Math Class

choices: "I won't give you the key! You're a time eater!"
111111121.content:
You focus your thoughts and then all time slows down once more. You open your math book to start to study, and even compare your quiz to the book.

When a hissing sound is heard from behind, you turn around to see the snake moving towards you, not stopped by the slowing of time at all.

"Yessssssss," the snake hisses. The hair on the back of your neck stands on end, and your eyes grow wide in their sockets. "The time guardian, yessssss?"

You stand up and look from the snake to the door. "There'ssssss no need for that. Just hand over the key, yesssssss?"

You think back to the old man. What had he said?
111111121.title: Confronting the First Time eater

1111111211.content:
Your School...

"Never!" you shout. You hurl your desk at the snake, but it has no effect.

"Hey, no rough-housing." the snake says, transforming from a snake into a tall, gaunt man.

You manage to evade him, ducking behind the desks. It's like a game of Cat-and-Mouse...and you're about to lose. The man has you cornered when he stops. His eyes go white. "What the-" you begin, but stop as you see a sword slice the time-eater's chest in half.

As the sword cuts the man in two, there's another warrior standing behind him. "You...traitor! I always...knew you...would betray...us." the other warrior says. Then he dies, his eyes go completly white, his face a mask of hatred.

His eyes burn out of his sockets and his whole body burns until there's nothing left but white bones. The man who saved you looks down at the skeleton in scorn. "Nobody can betray a Brotherhood that's full of traitors to the Time Order." he says, smashing the skull with his boot. He looks down at you and smiles.

"W-W-Who are you?" you say, shaking with fear. It's understandable-you've almost been killed and then see someone killed in front of you.

"My name is Aldor, a Time Warrior. Opposite to the Time-Eaters, my guild protects Time, and the one who wields it. I am the last of our order-the Time-Eaters wiped out all of my kin. So, here I am to protect you, since the old Time-Keeper has gone into retirement, in Florida." the man says.

"So...I don't have to worry about the Time-Eaters?" you say. The man shakes his head.

"Most of them you'll find I will stop, but those of the Elite, there are some who may defeat me. Then you will have to fight for yourself." Aldor says.

"But how? I mean, I'm only a kid, I mean, the other Keepers must have had a pretty hard-" you begin, but stop as Aldor's eyes fill with fury.

"But how? You're the Time-Keeper! You have within you the Sword of Time, the Shield of Time, and most importantly, the Rage of Time! Use these weapons! What you have just said has insulted all in your order to the extreme! I will guide you, as I have done so with the other Time-Keepers." he shouts. He soon calms down, however.

"Don't worry. I doubt the Eilte will come-they're too lazy." Aldor says.
1111111211.title: The Protecter of the Time-Keepers

11111112111.content: You finish the test, then make time normal, nobody else is done. They stare at you when you hand in your test. Then you slow time to....
11111112111.title: Wow your test was FAST!

choices: I think Aldor's a Time Eater - I should run away
I don't think Aldor's a Time Eater - I should keep walking with him
111111121111.content:
You head to your house with Aldor walking alongside you and explaining more about the Time Eaters.
         "No one knows where the Time Eaters came from, or what they really are. We know that time doesn't seem to be the same for them as it is for everyone else. I'm sure you noticed that the Time Eater back in the classroom was unaffected by your slowing down of time?"
         You nod.
         "That's one of the mysteries about them. They don't seem to be able to slow down the flow of time like you can as the Time Guardian. We never could figure out exactly what was different about them, why they were immune to changes in the flow of time."
         You and Aldor walk across a busy street, easily weaving through the crawling cars.
         "They can change shape, just like the one back at the school did. Anyone or anything could potentially be a Time Eater... the only way to be sure is to distort time. If they are a Time Eater, they'll be unaffected - it's a dead giveaway. Of course, using your powers also points you out to the Time Eater - he'll notice that you're moving at normal speed, unlike everyone else."
         Wait a minute... you think. He said that anyone might be a Time Eater, and that they're unaffected by slowing down time. Aldor's unaffected... could he be a Time Eater?
         Watching him carefully, you slow time down further. Unfazed, he keeps on walking - he doesn't even seem to notice.
         Maybe he is a Time Eater, and he's trying to trick me into giving him the Key. But if so... why did he kill that other Time Eater? And why is he telling me all this?
         What do you think?
111111121111.title: Walking and Talking

1111111211111.content:
You bolt away from Aldor.
         "Wait! Come back!" he calls.
         You dart into a nearby alley, tipping over some trash cans to slow him down. You hear him smash into them a second later.
         "It's dangerous for you to go out on your own without knowing how to use your powers fully! Come back here!"
         Ignoring him, you sprint out of the alley and around the corner. You run a few more blocks, then duck into another alley.
         "Think I lost him..." you gasp, leaning against the wall.
         "INDEED!"
         You jump at the incredibly loud voice, then look to see who's speaking.
         A giant stands blocking the only exit. He smiles evilly.
         "HAND OVER THE KEY!"
         You slowly back up a step, then turn and run to the other end of the alley. Another giant steps out from around the corner, cutting off your escape.
         "THERE IS NO ESCAPE. GIVE US THE KEY!"
         The giant advances towards you. You slow down time, but he just grins diabolically and keeps coming.
         "SUCH TRICKS ARE OF NO USE. THE KEY IS OURS!"
         The giant behind you pins your arms behind your back, then the other giant pulls back his arm to punch you.
         WHAM!
         You fall to your hands and knees, gasping. One of the giants lifts his foot over you.
         "SEEMS YOU'VE RUN OUT OF TIME!"
         It can't end like this! you think. It can't-
1111111211111.title: Trapped

111111121112.content:
Chances like this don't come every day....
         You walk over to Lindsay (the most beautiful girl in school, in your humble opinion), slowing down time as you get close. You close your eyes, pucker your lips, and...
         "Ahem."
         You almost jump out of your skin! Aldor looks at you disapprovingly.
         "Heh heh... sorry. Guess I forgot you were standing there...."
         "We have to go now. There's no time for your childish antics," he says, turning to the door.
         "Come on! Just a quick peck on the cheek?" you plead.
         "No! You have a lot to learn, and not much time to learn it in. Let's get a move on!"
         Sighing, you follow after Aldor.
111111121112.title: Aldor the Chaperone

1111112.content:
"Yeah, right. Like I'm gonna waste my time messing with some stupid key! Find some one else to bother, ya old fart!"
         You throw the key, and the instant it leaves your hand, a creature leaps from the shadows and grabs it.
         Could that be one of those "time eaters" he spoke of?you wonder. It just grabbed the key! Oh no!
         "Oh no" is right. The creature grins evilly, then pops the key in its mouth. As it does so, you feel something go wrong with the world.
         You try to use your powers, but feel a startling emptiness. It's not just like it isn't working... it's like you don't even have your powers any more.
         A high-pitched noise fills your ears, getting louder and louder. You fall to your knees in agony, holding your hands over your ears. Through the pain, you see that all the people around you are no longer frozen... and that they also are on the ground in agony. The ground starts shaking, and everything fades to black.
         As your mind slowly drifts away, you realize that this is
1111112.title: Out of time

111112.content:
"Why did I receive my powers?" you ask.

"You received your powers because you need to exterminate your lost father," he explains, "Your father is a insane person who is murdering innocent people. He is a very dangerous man and has a super power that allows him to shooting lasers from his eye. Unfortunately, he is a master of disguise and no-one knows where he is or where he's coming next. All we know is that your family can help find him and defeat him. You'll need your family's help though."

"Ho-" you try to say before being interrupted by the old man.

"Your brother and mum will receive powers in the next few hours but will take almost a full year to fully control it. We can make this process a lot more faster if you take a private jet to a remote island in the middle of the Indian Ocean. I do not know what powers your family will receive but from what I found out with your super power that you gained, their super powers will be based on their personalities."

"Wait!" you say with a confused look on your face, "How do you know my family?"

"That's enough questions young one, you need to get a ride to the White House to get a private jet, I'll answer your question later. Just make sure that with great powers comes great responsibility." he warns before he disappears in a white light resuming time to it's normal state.

For the rest of the school day, you decided not to use your powers. It was actually easy since Bruno hasn't done anything to you all day. Maybe he's got his payback already for today at least you thought. After school is over, you walk home without using your powers but when you get home, you ring the doorbell and you see the door opened by...
111112.title: Why did I recieve my powers?

choices: Say "I can slow down time for me but not for everyone else."
1111121.content: Your brother says, "How the heck have you been going so fast the past two days? It's like your the Flash!"
1111121.title: Your brother

choices: "On second thought, I think I will use my powers"
11112.content:
If I use my powers too much, people'll start to get suspicious...
         OOMF!
         Bruno hits you in the back and you sink to your knees, gasping in pain. Man, he punches hard!
         CRACK!
         Something hard slams into the back of your head and you fall over onto your side. You roll over onto your back and see Bruno raising a baseball bat for another blow.
         You think to yourself:
11112.title: Brutal!

111121.content: As he is about to hit me in the head with a baseball bat or whatever he wants to do to me, I decide to use my superwarp, slow motion, ninja powers. I bring my right foot up quickly and kick him in the stomach, he groans loudly. "Man, if I ever get ahold of you you'll wish you never messed with me", he groans. "If you only knew, but then again, I'm sworn to secrecy so I can't say anything about this", I said. "Tell me about what?", he says making a disgusted face at me. "You'll never know, unless, one: I were to tell you, or two: you went through it yourself." "Whatever, you know what man, you are psyco", he says and walks away. Now I wonder if I'll ever have trouble with him again, if I do, then I'd sure hate to find out.
111121.title: Confronting the Bully

111122.content:
WHAM!
         The baseball bat slams into your face, and pain makes your vision blur. You dimly see Bruno lift the bat for yet another blow.
         "This'll teach you to make a fool of me," he snarls.
         "Stop! Stop it this instant!"
         A security guard tackles Bruno, and your Math teacher runs over to you and kneels at your side.
         "Somebody call an ambulance!" she shouts, cradling your head and wiping your brow with a handkerchief.
         "Just hang in there. It'll be okay."
         You try to respond, but it hurts too much to speak.
111122.title: Bruno's Temper

1111221.content:
The doctors tell you that Bruno broke your nose and jaw. You believe them, because your face hurts bad.
         Guess I'll be slurping soup through a straw for the next month or two... you think glumly.
1111221.title: Aftermath

choices: Explain to Jack about your powers
1112.content:
You start to slow down time, but then think better of it. No need to make people suspicious. You close your eyes and wait.
         WHAM!
         Pain flashes through your jaw. You stagger back, reeling from the blow.
         SMACK!
         You totter, then fall to the ground. Bruno starts kicking you. The world becomes a haze of pain.
         "Hey you! Stop!"
         You hear Bruno run away. Someone helps you to your feet. Your eyes focus. It's your friend, Jack.
         "What's wrong with you? You didn't fight back at all." Jack asks angrily.
1112.title: Exercising Self-Control

choices: Let Bruno get hit! He deserves it!
11121.content:
"Yah I know. I've got a lot on my mind today" You cautiously move your jaw around, hoping it still works, rub your ribs and lean back against the locker.
"Man what a jerk, you only bumped into him!" He sits down beside you, his chains jingling as they curl up on the floor around him. He leans up against the lockers beside you and cracks his neck. Jack is a punk. He's wearing old black jeans with obvious red stitching where he sewed up the many rips that appeared over the years. His shaggy hair, dyed orange to celebrate the fall, hangs a bit in front of his eyes. Jack reaches into the breast pocket of his red, plaid shirt and pulls out his zippo and proceeds to flick it on and snap it shut.
"Hey Jack, u wanna skip chem?"
Jack drops his lighter and slowly turns his head toward you. His face a vision of shock and bewilderment. "Did you just ask me if i want to skip? You never want to skip! Holy crap! I'm Finally getting through to that nerdy little brain of yours!" Jack ruffles your hair and breaks into a very odd celebration dance, people walk around his antics on they're way to class. He stops abruptly and jumps back down beside you.
"Wait a sec. Why do you want to skip today? Even when Bruno stole your pants that one time you didn't want to miss chem. You forget," he says, shaking a finger at you, "I'm sharper than I look."
"I'll tell you in a bit, let's just get onto the bike trails first." You stand up slowly and start walking towards the door to outside. Jack grabs his lighter and follows you.
As you walk onto the bike trails, a scenic path through the trees, you think to yourself how easy it was to skip just then. Not at all like the movies where a sadistic principal stalks you all over town.
"So what's wrong? Bruno finally driving you zany?"
"No it's not him"
"Girl problems?"
"Not more than usual."
"Weird life changing super powers?"
"Actually yah." You look at him with wonder at how he figured it out so fast.
"Right, but seriously whats up? You don't seem yourself today."
"Well i woke up today with superpowers."
"Oh! So you really are having problems with super powers." Jack rolls his eyes and starts laughing. "If You have powers, why didn't you use them to, oh i don't know, not get hit!"
"They kind of freaked me out! I don't want the school thinking I'm more of a freak than they already do!" You frantically explain to Jack who looks at you dumbly.
"Ok my friend is loopy. What to do? What to do?" Jack backs away in mock fear, "Listen," Jack starts, being serious again, "I'm actually trying to help you so lets get back to the topic of whats different about you and no more superpower jokes, ok?"
As he says this you concentrate, you hear his voice deepen dramatically, and he slows right down to almost a standstill. You snag his zippo from his pocket
"Ok. Oh hey, here's your lighter." You toss Jack his zippo. He catches it and gives you an odd look then lights up a mini cigar, puffing lightly to get it going, then replaces his lighter to his pocket.
You concentrate again and see a red leaf nearly stop mid-fall just to the right of Jack, very slowly fluttering through the air. You again dip your hands into his shirt pocket and grab the lighter.
"Catch." You toss him the lighter and he catches it out of reflex. Then his cigar drops from his mouth as a look of confusion crosses his face.
"How did you..." His voice trails off as he tries to make sense of things.
"Jack, no joke, somethings happening to me." You start.
"Wait. I don't believe this." Jack holds his lighter between thumb and forefinger right in front of his face, "Ok get it now."
You concentrate again and easily slip it from his grip, however this time you stay right in front of Jack instead of moving back to your spot.
"Holy crap man!"Jack falls flat on his butt and grabs the nearby cigar, taking a long drag and enhaling deeply. "You're freaking serious? Holy crap!" Jack jumps up and walks to a nearby bench and sits down.
"You allright man?" you ask.
"Yah this is just kinda confusing. So what is it you can actually do?"
You sit down beside him and put your head in your hands, "Well as far as i can tell i can slow down time."
"Wow man. This is nuts. Ok I have an idea!" Jack sits up straight with a brilliant look on his face.
"Oh no, what are you going to do now?" You ask even though you don't really want to know. Jack always has a crazy idea, usually it ends up with him in trouble and you making up an excuse. This time you suspected it would be a bit crazier than usual.
"That Bruno guy is always bugging you, right? Well now's your chance for a little revenge!" an evil grin flashes across jacks enthusiastic face as he pulls you up and through the path back to school.
As you approach the school you can see Bruno in the parking lot, leaning against his car, bragging about it to a group of giggling air-heads.
"You could scratch his car right in front of his eyes and he wouldn't even know it! Imagine his face! Oh wait, even better! Just walk up behind him and pants him, like he did you, and then scratch his car!"
"Your right! I could finally get payback for the beatings!"
"That's the spirit! Now go get that jerk!" Jack pats you on the back and sits down to watch the fun.
You begin to walk over when you see another car fly across the parking lot, the driver showing off its power to his buddies. A grade 10 runs into the path of the roaring beast, the driver cranks the wheel to miss the kid and flies right at the back of Bruno. Bruno turns around just in time to see a ton of metal and horsepower ready to pinch him between itself and his car.
11121.title: The Cat Out of The Bag

111211.content:
You slow the time down as the car skid towards Bruno. You charged at him with full force. It felt like you hit a brick wall. The two of you tumled onto the ground then took off as the car hit the other Bruno's car. You ran back to Jack, who was staring at the event. You snapped time back to normal.

You and Jack ran towards the incident as the other students did. Burno was geting up off the ground and looked at the two cars. Bruno was swearing up a storm as the teachers came to check out the scene.

"Are you alright," you called.

Bruno looked at you and nodded. He was trying to figure out what happened. The teachers started asking all the students what happened. It was the same stories: One second Bruno was standing at the spot where the car hit and the next second, Bruno was on the ground and the car missed him.

All the students headed back to the class. As you started back to class, Bruno stopped you.

"Hey, thanks for asking if I was alright. I can't beleive what happened. I thouht I was dead for sure," Bruno said.
111211.title: A Hero

choices: You lose consciousness, failing to save bruno
You push beyond the pain and push time back a bit
111212.content:
For one moment all the hatred and anger towards bruno swells up inside of you and you dont do anything. you watch the car as it slams into bruno. even from this distance, you can still clearly hear the crunch of bruno's hips as they get pounded to dust. 11122.content:
You shrug and walk away. I trust Jack, but I still shouldn't tell him about my newfound ability... in fact, it might be wise not to tell anyone.
         "Don't just walk away from me!" Jack calls from behind you. You hear him jogging to catch up.

111221.content:
You decide that your house should be a safe enough place to go. Your parents are both at work and your brother always goes to his friend's house after school.
         First, I'll see how slow I can make things.
         You concentrate, then take a coin out of your pocket and let go of it in midair. The coin hangs almost motionless in midair.
         OK, now let's see... can I speed time up?
         The coin falls to the carpet at normal speed. Just to make sure, you watch the clock for one minute... and it seems to be moving at a normal rate. If it's any faster, the difference is so slight that you didn't notice it.
         Right then, no speeding things up.
         You spend the rest of the time experimenting, and as you do, you discover something. Anything you touch gets pulled out of time with you. So, potentially, you could take someone out of time with you... but if you lost contact with them, they would slow down along with everything else until you touched them again.
         Interesting... you think.
111221.title: Accelerated Learning

choices: slow time then talk to the nice cheerleader?
1112211.content: As you realize what your power can do, you smile, as look out your bedroom window, and notice one of the neighborhood girls, who a nice cheerleader from school, is outside her house, you've always wanted to talk to her, now that you can slow down time, maybe you can find the courage to talk to her, or maybe you should concentrate on controlling smaller objects? what will you do?
1112211.title: Continue

choices: Try to run and grab her
112.content:
You have a bad habit. Whenever your alarm clock goes off and wakes you up, you smash it. You don't even make a decision consciously, it's just a reflex or something. After going through 4 alarm clocks in a single week, you came up with a solution: put the alarm clock on a table on the other side of the room. That's been working pretty good so far. You haven't smashed a single alarm clock (although the spot on your dresser where your old alarm clocks went has taken quite a beating). Today, though, your method failed you.
         BEEP BEEP BEE-
         KZZZAAARRRRPPP!
         You roll out of bed, stand up, and pause. KZZAARRPP? That noise isn't part of my morning routine.... You look over at your table. Right where your alarm clock used to be, there's a big black mark on the table. You lean in to look closer and notice that it smells like burnt wood.
         You think through the last few minutes. I was sleeping, then the alarm clock went off, and then...
         You stretch out your hand towards your trash can and concentrate.
          PSSSHHHHOOOOWW!
         A beam of light shoots from your hand and blasts the trash can. It flips up into the air, slinging wadded up paper, half of an old sandwich, and a broken pencil onto your carpet. You try again.
          KER-ZZAAAPP! PA-CHING! ZZZZOOOOWW!
         The trash can flies up into the air again, and you hit it twice in midair, juggling it. It lands in the middle of your bed. You grab it to put it back on the floor.
         "YOW!"
         You quickly drop the trash can. That thing's HOT! You put on your shoes, then nudge it with your foot until it is off the bed and in the corner again.
         After cleaning up the mess that you made, you get dressed and go to school. Since your teachers are all droning on and on, you end up sleeping through most of your classes.
          The final bell rings and you burst from the building. As you're walking back to your house, you notice a little girl playing ball in her yard. Her ball bounces out into the street and she runs after it without looking. Oh no! A car is headed right for her!
112.title: I Go Through More Alarm Clocks...

choices: Go hang out at the basketball courts with your friends
1121.content:
You blast the car's left tire, and it veers off the road. It slams into a telephone pole. The driver swings open his door and stomps towards you.
         "What do you think you're doing? Do you know how much that car costs? I was hitting the brakes, you moron! I wouldn't have hit her! You're going to pay for every last penny of damage that you've caused, and-"
         You fire a warning blast at his feet, then point your hand at his head. You concentrate, and your hand begins to glow softly.
         "Whoa! Whoa! Take it easy, pal. I was just leaving. Have a nice day!"
         The man holds his hands up and slowly walks back to his car. He gets in, then speeds off.
         You pull a lolly-pop out of your backpack and hand it to the little girl.
         "Don't tell anybody about this, okay? Now, go on and play with your ball."
         The little girl nods, grabs the candy and her ball, and walks back to her house.

choices: Blast the man with your lasers and take all of his money.

11211.content:
At home you begin to think about things.

This new power is truly amazing. You could do good things with it, but... on the other hand, you could do evil things with it.

At dinner you barely talk to your family. Dad is going on about some corporate deal he's trying to push through. Mom is talking about the new meatloaf recipe she just received from some neighbor you've never even heard of. Your little sister is blabbing about her day at school.

You go to bed early.

The next morning you wake up late, since you destroyed your clock the day before. You hurry on to school, taking some shortcuts that your mom would most definately not approve of. In one of the alleys you cut through, you are stopped by a large man.

"Give me all your money," he says.

You must act quickly.
11211.title: Good versus Evil

112111.content:
"You just picked the wrong guy to hassle, buddy."
         TZZAAPP!
         A beam of bright light hits him square in the chest. You grin, waiting for him to go flying back. Half a minute later, you're still waiting.
         Frowning, you concentrate harder. The beam widens and grows brighter, making an audible humming noise as it strengthens. The man still stands there, and you think you see a small grin on his face.
         "Rrrraaaaaagggghhh!" you scream as you focus your thoughts completely on using your powers. The beam widens still further, and it grows so bright that you can hardly stand to look at it. The humming noise becomes so loud that it hurts your ears. You notice that the air around you starts crackling, and a stray beam of energy arcs from your shoulder to a nearby fire escape.
         Finally, the man reacts. He staggers back, a look of disbelief on his face. He shouts "W...wait! It was only a test! STOP!"
112111.title: A Test?

choices: Go have fun with the money
1121111.content:
KA-THOOM!
         Just as you think you can't hold the beam any longer, the man goes flying back and hits the wall. You relax and the beam stops. The man's feet slide out from underneath him, and he slumps to the ground, unconscious.
         Your head is swimming, and there is a ringing in your ears from the loud humming noise your laser made. You stagger over to the man to take his money.
         You see that the man's jacket was destroyed by your beam, and underneath he was wearing some strange type of armor. It's scorched black and smoking.
         "So that's how he was able to withstand my blast...." you mutter to yourself. Checking his pockets, you find several hundred dollars in cash.
         "Wow! This guy was loaded! I wonder... was he more than just a common criminal? Oh well, he learned his lesson!"

The helicopter disappears over a rooftop, then reappears almost directly above you. It seems to be tracking you....
         You have a bad feeling about this.

112112.content:
You quickly look around for a distraction. Glancing up, you see a fire escape with a retractable ladder at the bottom. It'll take good aim... but it just might work, you think.
         You throw your hands up in the air and yell "Don't shoot! I'll give you my money, just don't shoot!"
         The man grins and takes a step forward, walking almost directly underneath the fire escape. Bingo! You smile to yourself as you tilt your right hand just a tiny bit, so that your fingertips are now aimed at the ladder. You concentrate.
         TSSAAP! The beam glances off the side of the ladder, releasing the latch that holds it up. The ladder falls down directly in front of the man. It slams down on top of his hand, smacking the gun from his grasp. The gun clatters to the ground and lands at your feet.
         You pick up the gun and then turn and run away. You run towards the street, tossing the gun in a dumpster as you go.
         BLAM! You dive to the ground and cover your head with your hands. Did he have another gun? you wonder. You count to 5, then climb to your feet and spin around. The man is cradling his injured hand and rocking back and forth. No way he took a shot at you. Hmm. What could have made that sound? you wonder.
         You look over at the dumpster and see a bullet hole in its side. Curiously, you walk up to it and peer down inside. The gun still has smoke curling from the barrel. The impact must have made it fire...you think. Note to self: do not throw loaded guns.

Here goes nothing... you think grimly.
         TSSS-CHOW!
         You blast the box, and the ride slows to a stop. The kids stagger off of it. Some of them are crying. One loses his lunch in some nearby bushes.
         Phew! That was close!
         "You saved those kids! You're a hero!" a man exclaims from behind you.
         You spin and face him, smiling. A mass of grateful parents quickly surrounds you, holding their children and thanking you profusely.
         You slowly manage to slip away from the crowd. As you turn to leave, a TV van pulls up to the merry-go-round. It disgorges a small army of reporters and camera crew. They disperse into the crowd, interviewing the parents. You overhear one of the interviews.
         "Sir, how were all of these children saved?" a reporter asks.
         "It was that young man over there! He's a true hero!" he exclaims happily, pointing to you.
         The reporter thanks the man for his time, then moves over to interview you.
         "How did you stop the ride?" he asks eagerly.
1121121112.title: 15 Minutes of Fame

11211211122.content:
You consider his question, then decide that it would be better to keep your powers secret. I can still tell him the basic truth... you decide.
         "I shorted out the power box," you explain, leading the man over to it. The box is charred black and its front cover is warped. Upon looking inside, you find that the delicate circuitry is fried.
         "Ladies and gentlemen, this is absolutely incredible! This box is totally demolished, and it seems that the merry-go-round is also beyond repair." the reporter says, looking into the camera.
         "It is only by this young man's heroism that many innocent children were saved. Though we have been witness to many tragedies throughout the years, this story ends happily because of one man's courage and quick thinking. His deeds are an inspiration to us all."
         Your interview done, you head home. Your mom greets you at the door.
         "Where were you all day? Your principal called and said that you didn't show up at school today! You had better have a good explanation, mister!"
         Smiling, you turn on the TV to the 6 o'clock news. Your mom sees you on TV and stares blankly at the screen as the reporter explains what happened. When the station breaks to a commercial, she turns to you, wide-eyed.
         "You saved those children?" she asks.
         You nod.
         "That's amazing! You're a hero!" she exclaims, hugging you.
         She calls to your father, and you tell him what happened (minus the part about your powers). You all go out to your favorite restaurant, McDenny's, for dinner. You spend the rest of the evening celebrating with your parents, and crawl into bed late that evening.

112112111221.content:
Your eyes fade to a crack, and your mind slips into the inky, black unconsciousness.of sleep.

Maybe ten minutes later, or maybe five hours later, you are jolted out of your slumber by a dry, hideous cackle. You briefly wonder if this sound was only the tail-end of some horrible nightmare, one of that rare variety so viscerally frightening that the violent awakening from whence you emerge from it is usually caused by the sound of your own piteous, pleading gasps for help.

Your fears are assuaged as you feel the coolly familiar linens and breathe in the comforting, musty olfactory signature of your own room.

A frantic, grasping hand lunges from the floor and firmly seals your mouth. You struggle to throw off this horrifying skeletal appendage, but to no avail. You soon realize, after a fevered glance for any defense, that your arms and legs are securely bound to the bed with copious amounts of a strong adhesive tape.

A face to match the cruelty of the assault rises to meet your gaze and, seeing the terror in your eyes, can only grin a mile wide. His eyes are merely the veneer of eyes. Behind them lie nothing but cold, nihilistic pools that only know how to mock that which they reflect. The laugh you heard was real, and now, so will be the nightmare.....

Who is this man, and why has he come here????

         The concern on your friends' faces brings you out of your rage. It's not their fault. No need to take it out on them... you decide.
         "I'm fine. Don't worry about me," you mutter.
         Juan looks at you closely. "You sure, man? You looked angry enough to kill something!"
         "Your face was so red, it almost looked like it was glowing!" Joe remarks.
         "I thought you were gonna go berserk!" Kyle adds.
         You drop your gaze and shove your hands into your pockets, trying to hide your inner turmoil.
         They all watch you uncertainly. A few uneasy moments pass, then Juan shrugs and says "Anyways, we were thinking of going to the arcade. You wanna come?"

1121221.content:
Your anger is quickly forgotten as you play games at the arcade. You race a few laps of Turbo Racing, then defeat challenger after challenger at Sword Chronicles 2.
         A couple hours later, you and your friends part ways. It's only about 7:30... you think. Maybe I should stop by OmegaMart and see if they have any new videogames...."

11212211.content:
You roam back to the electronics section, then quickly scan the games. They've got Sword Chronicles 3! Awesome!
         You grab the last copy, then happily walk to the end of a checkout line.
         The man in front of you strides up to the clerk, puts his groceries on the counter, then pulls out a gun. "Give me all your money," he snarls.
         "Hey, freeze!" a security guard yells, running toward the thief.
         The thief spins toward the guard and levels the gun at him.
         I have to do something! you think desperately.

112122111.content:
You blast the thief in the back of the head. He stumbles forward.
          BLAM!
         The thief pulls the trigger and collapses. The guard drops to one knee, holding his side and grimacing. You can see blood between his fingers.
         "All right, nobody move! Put your hands in the air!"
         You turn around and see another thief holding a gun and shouting to the crowd. He glares at you.
         "You! Hands in the air! Now!"

1121221111.content:
You raise your hands and hold perfectly still. The thief grins darkly and calls out "Jerry, Terrance. Teach this fool a lesson."
         A thug emerges from behind a magazine rack and walks toward you menacingly.
         Maybe I should try to fight... wait a minute. Didn't he say two names? Where's the other-?
         Your thoughts are interrupted by a heavy blow to the back of your head. You fall to the ground, unconscious.

choices: Try to escape on your own
11212211111.content:
You slowly come to. Your head throbs and you have a stiff neck from the awkward position you've been laying in.
         When you open your eyes, you see that you're in a cramped room with a bunch of other people.
         "What's going on?" you ask.
         "The thieves locked us all in here while they ransack the place," a woman informs you. "They said they'd let us out when they were done, but it's been over an hour. I think they're holding us hostage!"
         You clamber to your feet and shake your head to clear the cobwebs. Suddenly, you remember the guard that got shot.
         "Is the wounded security guard here?" you ask the woman.
         She nods and points to the far corner of the room.
         I have to do something about this situation, you think. Maybe the guard can help me....
11212211111.title: Hostage

choices: He won't be able to help me. Guess I have to go it alone.

You walk over to the guard and kneel beside him.
         "Are you hurt bad?"
         He looks up at you.
         "No. The bullet didn't do too much damage, but the wound bled quite a bit. I'm feeling kind of woosy."
         You think:
112122111111.title: The Wounded Guard

choices: Give the guard a little time to recover, then ask for his help
Decide to break out without his help
1121221111111.content:
"Let me see," you urge the guard.
         He winces, then slowly moves his hands away from the wound. It immediately starts bleeding again. You can see the end of the bullet just an inch or two inside the wound.
         "Man, this thing still hasn't clotted?" you ask.
         He shakes his head. "My doctor put me on blood thinners. It makes it difficult for my blood to clot. Every time I move, it starts bleeding again."
         You tell him, "We need to get that bullet out of you and stop the bleeding. This'll probably hurt..."
         You slowly reach into the wound and draw out the bullet, then examine the wound. It's bleeding freely now.
         "I'm gonna have to cauterize this," you decide. "Hold still."
         "What...? How are you...?" the guard stammers.
         You point your finger at the wound and focus. A soft glow surrounds your hand, and then a pencil-thin ray of light strikes his wound.
         "Aaargh!" the guard groans in pain.
         "Hold still! Don't move!" you command.
         After a few seconds, you relax and the beam stops. The heat from your beam sealed off the wound, stopping the bleeding.
         The guard looks down at the bullet hole, then gasps "Thank you."
1121221111111.title: Medic

1121221112.content:
You take a quick potshot at the thief, but narrowly miss him. Sneering, he aims his gun at you.
         BLAM! BLAM! BLAM!
         Pain rips through your chest and you look down to see blood staining your shirt.
         He got me...
         You fall to the ground, dead.
1121221112.title: A Fatal Mistake

choices: Roam around town, looking for an excuse to use your new power
1122.content:
You run as fast as you can and snag the little girl. She looks up at you, surprised.
         SCREEEEECH!
         The car squeals to a stop mere inches away from you both. The driver leans on his horn, gesturing angrily at you.
         You take the little girl over to her yard and set her down. The driver roars off.
          Pop!
          The jerk! He ran over the little girl's ball and popped it. Tears sparkle in her eyes.
         "Wait just a minute," you tell the little girl. "I'll fix your ball and bring it back to you."
         You run a few blocks to your house, go to the garage and get your bicycle pump. The ball has a big hole in it, but it seems to all be there. You pinch the hole shut, then point your free hand at it. As you focus, a faint beam of light projects onto the hole and welds it shut. You use the bike pump to fill the ball with air, then run back to the little girl's house and give her the ball.
         "Thank you, mister!" the little girl exclaims happily.
         She eagerly grabs the ball and runs off to play with it.
         "Stay out of the street!" you call after her.
         You go home and eat dinner with your family. Afterwards, you go to sleep.
         The next day, you oversleep. You wake up groggily. Why didn't my alarm clock go off? you wonder. You glance over at it, and see that it isn't there. A burnt spot is where it used to be. Oh yeah. Then, it hits you: you're late to school! You run into the kitchen and look at the clock on the wall. 10:30! Why didn't your mom wake you up? You notice a post-it note stuck to the toaster. It reads:

I brought you some breakfast from McDenny's. I put it in the oven to keep it warm. Enjoy your day off from school!
         -Mom

         Oh yeah. There's no school today. Opening the oven, you take out the McDenny's bag and peer inside. Oh yeah! A Combo Burrito with extra Panic Sauce!
         You take a bite. AAAAHHH! It feels like a thousand people armed with flamethrowers and napalm launchers are having a war inside your mouth. THAT is some good Panic Sauce!

When you finish your burrito (and drink a tall glass of milk), you decide what you should do with your day off.

1122212.content:
By the time you get to the Rothwell Building, the show has already started. You slip in the back and watch quite possibly the lamest magic show on earth.
         Xanto does a bunch of tricks that you've seen hundreds of times. He pulls a rabbit out of his hat, saws a woman in half, makes a coin disappear from under a cup, and does a couple simple card tricks.
         Well, it's about time to liven this show up... you think, slowly working your way towards the stage.
         "For my next trick, I'm going to disappear before your very eyes! Watch closely!"
         Xanto closes his eyes, bows his head, and folds his hands behind his back. He stands there motionless for a second, then you're blinded by a brilliant flash of light. When your eyes clear, you see that he's disappeared!
         What the...? I've never seen that trick done before! How'd he do that?!
         You strain your eyes, searching for a trap door, a mirror, anything that he might have used to slip away.
         No way! He didn't get into a box, step behind a curtain, nothing! One minute he was there... the next, he was gone!

The audience stares at the stage in shock. Murmurs begin to ripple through the crowd as the seconds tick by.
         Suddenly, there is another brilliant flash of light! Blinking, you see that Xanto has reappeared onstage! The crowd erupts into applause as he bows.
         "And now for my last, most amazing trick of all. Observe!"
         Xanto again bows his head and closes his eyes. While you watch, he slowly changes into a giant grizzly bear!
         How is that possible?! How did he just do that?! you wonder in amazement.
         The bear stands on its hind paws and roars. In midroar, it quickly changes into a lion! As you stare on in amazement, the lion becomes a terrible green ogre. The ogre yells and swings his club in the air as pyrotechnics erupt overhead. After a moment, the ogre fades away and Xanto reappears onstage, smiling.
         That's... that's impossible!
         The people in the crowd all stand staring at Xanto incredulously, then start cheering and clapping.
         "Thank you, thank you! Enjoy your evening, and thank you for coming to my show!"
         Xanto smiles and waves, then walks offstage. The audience slowly mills out of the room.
         I should go find Xanto and talk to him. There's no way that was just a trick! I have to find out his secret!

Help the person in the car first

1122221.title: Too Much to Do

11222211.content:
You decide to try and help the kids get out faster. But how? Suddenly the flames in the nearby car get bigger. You ramble your mind trying to find out a solution.
"I've got it!" you shout out to yourself.
You stick out your right hand, focusing your energy on heating up the tips of your fingers while balancing it to keep from shooting beams. Suddenly, your fingers glow red, and then you decide to take action. Sprinting toward the bus, you jump up and trace a hole in the back exit, a hole large enough for all of the children to get through. You try and comfort the panicking kids while escorting them out of the crash area. But then, you hear a WHOOSH! as the flames on the nearby car get bigger.
"Oh, crap!"
You dash over to the car and use your powers to heat up your whole body, thus becoming invincible to fire. You then move the drivers side of the car away from the flames. Returning to normal body temperature, you open the man's door, carrying an unconscious person to safety. You then, out of reflexes, take the car, and melt it to keep it from exploding.
People from all places come and thank you, and for once, you feel useful. Even though everything has happened so quick, it seems like it's always been this way, like this is what your destiny is.
To bad it was too good to last...
BOOOOOOOOOOOOOOOOOOOOOOOOOOOOOOOOOOOOOOOOOOOM!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!! !!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!
You feel a rush of flames overcome you, suddenly seeping inside you, filling your DNA with a burning sensation. Then you black out, no knowledge of what just happened, or why it happened, or who MADE it happen...


You wake up feeling different.
VERY different.
You're in a room, a dark room filled with lit candles and graffiti, mostly saying things like "Welcome to hell" or "You'll never escape" or pretty much any message that would threaten you or ruin your self esteem.
You look down at yourself, nothing broken, nothing burned, you're completely fine. Except for one detail.
You're wearing a skirt.
You look at your shoulder and see long, brown streaks of perfectly straight hair. Looking down at your chest you see that it looks like someone put two mega rubber balls under your shirt, which is a white, spaghetti-strapped tank top. Your feet are wearing pink shoes, slightly high-heeled. You're not wearing long, baggy jeans anymore, but instead are wearing a jean skirt, coming down to just above your knees. About to scream you get up, look in a mirror and see a beautiful face, with brown eyes and long, silky brown hair.
You don't have long hair.
"Ah, yes," a deep, rough voice says behind you, "You look so pretty Jessica."
You turn around to see a man, about in his 40's, with silver hair and gray eyes, one covered with an eye-patch.
Was he talking to me?
Shocked you reply,"M-my name is Jerry, sir."
You turn around to look at whoever said EXACTLY, what you were gonna say, but no one is around you except the man.
"Welcome to your new life... JESSICA."

You blast the hydrant and water sprays across the wreckage. That ought to take care of things! you think smugly.

         You have a sudden realization. This is an oil fire! Water doesn't work on-
         Your realization comes a few seconds too late. The gas tank blows, throwing you into the air. Your whole body is one big mass of pain as you land on the pavement half a block away. Everything gets dark....

         Did the kids all make it out in time? Well, you'll never know, because this is

choices: Good! He's finally learned his lesson!
1122222212.content:
The reckless man is still laying on his back nearby. Shaking your head, you walk over and nudge him with your foot.
         He moans and slowly opens his eyes.
         "... My... head...."
         The man stiffly sits up and looks around in confusion, rubbing the back of his neck. His gaze settles on you. Recognition sweeps over his face.
         "I remember you. You're that kid from yesterday, the one that ran out and grabbed that little girl...."
         "This is the second time I've had to save people from your dangerous driving. Wasn't yesterday enough to teach you not to be so hasty?" you scold him.
         "Oh, come on! Yesterday wasn't my fault! The little girl ran out in front of me! And today - that bus driver was going way too slow! It wasn't my fault that he...."
         He falters, seeing the look of irritation on your face.
         "... but if I hadn't been driving so crazily, I would have been able to react in time." He drops his gaze in shame. "I'm sorry. I won't drive like that any more."

         You think:
1122222212.title: Lesson Learned

11222222121.content:
You smile at the man. "Good. Let me help you to your feet," you say, pulling him up off the ground.

         "Is that the car's driver?"
         "Yes, officer. He's a little banged up, but seems to be okay."
         You lead the man over to a nearby bench and let him sit down there. The police officer goes over and begins questioning him.
         Nothing more that I can do here... time to get out of here before people start asking questions, you think as you slip into an alley.
11222222121.title: Merciful Hero

112222221211.content:
You hear the sound of quiet applause coming from above you. Startled, you jump back a step and look up.
         A mysterious, red-haired man is sitting on the fire escape, clapping and grinning ear to ear.
         "Good job..." he tells you. "Very good job! You saved the day, and you showed mercy to that reckless man when you saw that he'd learned his lesson."
         You stare at the mysterious stranger. He vaults over the fire escape's railing and lands a couple feet in front of you.
         "In fact, you did so well that I'm going to teach you a neat trick. Shall we begin?"
         You nod silently, too confused to speak.

         30 minutes later....

         Fighting exhaustion, you try once more to do as the stranger told you to. To your surprise, you finally succeed!
         Your hand glows and crackles with power. A brilliant white laser shoots from your fingertips, then stops in midair. The thin beam slowly flattens and spreads out until it forms a small circular disc that's about the size of a pizza.
         "You've done it! You made a laser shield! This one's pretty small, but as you practice you'll be able to make bigger ones. You can move it all around. Try it out!"
         You practice moving the laser shield. At first, you have to struggle. The more you do it, though, the easier it gets. This isn't so hard once you get the hang of it, you think happily.
         "Laser shields can block just about anything: bullets, rocks, other lasers, you name it," the stranger tells you.
         You're starting to feel a little light-headed. You relax and the shield fades away.
         "Well, I must be off. Before I go, though, let me offer you a word of caution: laser shields take quite a bit of energy to maintain. Until you get used to it, you probably shouldn't keep one going for extended periods. Well, see you around!"
         The mysterious man waves and then disappears into the shadows.

         Exhaustion makes your legs feel like lead weights. You stumble home and collapse on your bed, not even bothering to get under the blankets. Within moments, you're asleep.

1122222212111111111111111111.content:
You stare at the pictures, then back at the man. Then it hits you. ''yo-you mean?'' The man nods. ''i used to be one of the greatest, alongside all the heros that children continue to look up to to this day.'' You continue to stare blankly at the man. ''but then, something happened, something, that i not in a million years saw coming. apparantly according to the 'government', (you notice how he says the word government like it is some horrid curse word) i had become too reckless with my powers'' he continues. ''they shunned me, threw me out of the city, but i got them back. yeess, i made them pay for what they did to me.'' By now you are officialy creeped out and you decide that now it's probably a good time to get the heck outta here ''well, i've gotta go now, see ya.'' you say as you begin to walk out of the room, but as you get to the door it suddenly slams shut! You turn around and the man is glowering at you ''go? no i dont think so. i've waited for too long for this moment! and no little teenage punk is gonna mess it up for me now!'' You try to open the door but he pins you to the wall. ''Listen to me boy! You're powers are developed enough!'' You look at him, ''developed enough for what?'' The man smiles at you. ''Developed enough for me!'' You continue to stare blankly at him, ''what do you mean?'' The man frowns. ''when i was a superhero, i had the exact same powers as you. but much more powerful and developed. so developed that i could level a sky but after all my time living in exile and not exercising my powers, they have greatly diminished. oh sure i still remember how to use them. but i've lost the ability to use them myself. all was lost.'' A smile forms across his
face. ''but then i found you. When i saw you save those children from the bus, i knew it was a gift from god!'' now he begins shouting and ranting like a madman ''you were given your powers for a purpose! and that purpose was to allow me to reclaim my title as the greatest superhero of all time!'' Now your afraid, he's no longer the kind faced man you once knew. ''what are you saying!?'' Then a sudden realization comes over you, ''yo-you set the school on fire! you killed those people!'' The man smiles evilly, ''Bingo! Yeah i did that, but only because i had to! i had to get you to finish your training quickly! for you see, the longer i wait to absorb your powers, the more power I lose myself!, i only have less than an ounce of power left! i cant lose that or i'm done for!'' You stare in anger and shock at this new development. ''no, i-i wont! i'm turning you in to the police right now!'' You say as you blast open the locked door. You run out into the hall and towards the front door. you hear the man's voice behind you as you run outside. ''NO!!!!!!!!'' You run down the fire escape and down the street to your house.
1122222212111111111111111111.title: A Villain Revealed

112222222.content:
As you run over to the bus, the last few kids clamber out of the bus. They run to join their classmates. Suddenly, one of them trips and falls to the ground.
         KABOOM!
         Without thinking, you jump in front of the kid to shield him from the blast. A piece of shrapnel glances off the side of your head and you fall unconscious...

         "Is he okay?"
         "Should we call an ambulance? He's been out for quite awhile..."
         "I think he just moved!"
         You slowly open your eyes. Your head throbs with pain and the light hurts your eyes. Slowly, you make out a ring of faces staring down at you with expressions of concern.
         "Are you okay?" a man asks uncertainly.
         You nod, then slowly climb to your feet. You can't shake the feeling that something's... missing.
         You stumble through the crowd of onlookers, then have a sneaking suspicion. Pointing your hand at a nearby stop-sign, you try to blast it. Nothing happens.
         Just as you feared, the blow to your head took away your mysterious powers. At least I used them well while I had them, you think.
112222222.title: Split-Second Decision

113.content:
"No, no, no! That's not right at all!"
         You've been trying all evening to do your homework for Art class, but aren't having much luck. You crumple up your latest disaster and throw it in the wastebasket, then sit and think about what you're trying to draw.
         The castle should be dark, gloomy. There should be a storm brewing in the skies overhead. The drawbridge should be extended over a moat filled with dark water.
         You look down at your sketchbook. Okay. The drawbridge will be here- you make a light outline- and the castle spires will be here and here- you draw some light lines to mark the spot. I could maybe draw a couple guards on either side of the doorway-you lightly sketch a couple of stick figures....
         "Nice drawing!"
         You turn towards the voice. Your mom is looking over your shoulder at the blank page.
         "What do you mean, mom? I haven't drawn anything but a few guidelines."
         Your mom looks at you strangely. "Huh? That drawing's nearly finished! All it needs is some more details in a few spots."
          Confused, you turn to look at your mom. "You can see a picture on this paper?"
         "Yeah. It's all kinda dark and gloomy. There are storm clouds overhead, and there's a castle with a moat and drawbridge down towards the middle and bottom of the page."
         She described what you were going to draw perfectly! Now you're curious.
         "What do you think about this drawing, mom?"
         You flip your notebook open to another blank page. You imagine a picture of a little boy holding a red balloon.
         "Hmm.... it's not a bad start. The little boy could use a few more details, and the picture needs a background. Keep working on it."
          She's seeing what I'm imagining! you realize. Does it only work on pictures, or....
         "Hey, mom. I scraped my elbow in Gym class today."
         You imagine a slight scrape on your left elbow. You hold it up to show her. She squints.
         "Well, it doesn't look too bad. It'll heal quick. Your father won't be home from his business trip until tomorrow, so it's just you and me tonight, kiddo. Dinner's in about 5 minutes, so go wash your hands."
         You wash your hands, then go eat dinner with your mom. As you eat, she suddenly points at your arm.
          "Your scrape's gone! I thought it would heal fast, but I didn't expect it to go away THAT quickly!"

         "What the...?" The burglar stops in his tracks, staring at the operation.

         The figure puts the brain in the man's head, then quickly sews him up. The man suddenly sits up and meows.

         "Wha... wha...?" the burglar stammers, staggering back a couple steps.

         The man curls up on the table and purrs in agreement.

         "Nooooo!" the thief yells, diving out the window and then running for his life.
         That'll show him! you think smugly, then dissolve your illusion.

What do you do now?

choices: Continue showing the daydream on the blackboard
11321212.content:
You stumble through your morning routine like a zombie. Eat a bowl of Cheery Puffs, get dressed, sling your backpack over one shoulder and head out the door. You groan as you realize that your first class is History - not exactly the easiest class to stay awake in.

         You shuffle into the classroom and slide into a desk in the back. If I get lucky, maybe I can sneak a quick nap back here... you think.

         "Okay, class! Today we'll be continuing our study of the Revolutionary War and the events leading up to it! Please open your books to page 244."

         You dutifully flip your book open, then lay your head down and try to sleep. You hover right at the edge of unconsciousness, catching tiny snippets of the lecture.

         "...tensions continued to rise between the settlers and the British, leading to the Boston Tea Party..."

         Heh. Boston Tea Party. That reminds me of that one story... what was it? Oh yeah, "Alice in Wonderland." Where there was that one crazy guy with the hat, and....
         You dazedly daydream about the Mad Hatter and Alice sitting and having some tea in the middle of a Boston Harbor. You picture the Mad Hatter as wearing one of those tall British hats and a red coat, and Alice as wearing a uniform of muted colors like the settlers might have worn.

         "...one of the main causes of the American settlers' rebellion was the unfair taxes imposed by their British..."

         "Taxes." Tacks-es. Those are those little things that people put on seats as a joke, aren't they...? you wonder, disoriented.
         In your daydream, the Hatter produces a pail full of tacks out of his coat pocket. He and Alice reach into the pail, fill their hands with tacks, then toss them into the air. The tacks land all over: on the chairs, on the floor, in the tea....

         "...armies would sometimes have soldiers that played music on the flute or drums as they marched. This served to boost the troops' morale and also...."

         Now Alice and the Hatter start playing musical chairs, alternating between laughing in delight and wincing as they step on tacks. Each time the music stops, they plop down in a chair covered with tacks, then yell and hop up in pain.
         Heh, silly Alice. You shouldn't have scattered all those tacks.

         Through the haze in your mind, you see the girl sitting in front of you raise her hand. "Uh, Mrs. Appleton? There's... something... on the chalkboard behind you."

         The teacher turns and looks.

         "AAAAAH!"

         You bolt upright, awakened by your teacher's scream. What's her problem? you wonder.

         The students all start speaking at once.

         "It was there the whole time that you were...

         "...like a scene from Alice in Wonderland except..."

         "...pulled out this little pail that was full of..."

         "...playing musical chairs but the tacks were all..."

         Your eyes go wide as you realize what they're describing. That's my daydream! I must've been showing it on the blackboard without meaning to! And then when I woke up, I got distracted and stopped showing it....

then 5 mins before the class is halfway over most of them were passed out, crying, in fetal posistion except the teacher who is yelling in the kids direction and running into the wall XD

you break the illusion put everything back as it was making everyone into a sleeping spot, got back to your desk with the class halfway over and now fully awake

you snap them out of it then act worried as you start the chain reaction where you wake them up where the scream as you make them see each one of them see a GI with a M4 carbine, Waffen SS with an MP40, or a SAS with MP5's or SS officer with a luger, Gi with a colt .45 or a SAS with a M9 shushing them as they calm down, you try agian at waking them, and calming them which works as the teacher lets you all take a break as they recover from a Mass sleep XD but she didn't know that all the awake people were THAT tired? and the one sleepy looking person is okay? she disregarded it thinking that the sleeping didn't mean anything.

so now what?
113212121.title: Keep cool
