12.title: A Freak Accident

choices: Go have fun with your newfound ability
121.content:
Your morning starts out normal. You get out of bed, get dressed, brush your teeth, and try to comb your hair... or at least what's left of it. A few days ago you went to a new hair salon. Bad mistake. They mangled your hair. Butchered it. Slashed it like Wal-Mart slashes prices. You try to somehow fix it up, but the best hairstylist in the WORLD couldn't fix this.
         "I don't think I asked too much. Cut the bangs down to medium length, and a little trim on the sides and in the back." you mutter.
         You sit and imagine what your hair SHOULD look like. Then you walk downstairs and fix yourself a bowl of cereal.
         "Whoa. Nice haircut." your mom remarks as she walks in.
         "Yeah, right."
         Your mom turns and scrutinizes you for a moment.
          "I wasn't being sarcastic. I really like what you've done. How did you manage to fix what that chop-shop hair butcher did to you yesterday?"
         "I didn't."
         You finish your cereal, put the bowl in the sink, and walk back to the bathroom. You look in the mirror, and get a pleasant surprise: your hair looks normal again. No, more than that. It looks good!
         "How is that possible? I just saw my hair as a messed up nightmare half an hour ago." you think aloud.
         As you think about how your hair used to look, your hair changes! The bangs get uneven, the back shrinks until it's too short, the sides grow until they're too long. What the...?
         Your hair seems to be changing whenever you think about it. You decide to test your theory.
         "How about a... pony-tail!"
         Suddenly your hair pulls itself back and a small rubber band appears around it.
         "Liberty spikes!"
         Your hair gathers itself into small spires and juts out from your head in all directions.
         "Pig-tails!"
         Your hair braids itself into two pig-tails.
         You sit thinking for a moment, then decide to experiment further.
         I want to be an inch taller, have green eyes, and snow white hair!
         As you think it, it happens. You sit and consider this for a few moments, then revert to normal (except for your bad haircut, which you fix). You walk out the door and head to school. Then, you stop. I could really have fun with this....
121.title: Facing Changes

choices: Just scare him, but don't hurt him
1211.content:
You go to school. Between classes, you see a large, muscular bully brutalizing a smaller, scrawny kid. The skinny kid tries to get away, but the bigger kid just pulls him back and pounds him until blood is pouring from his mouth.

You have to do something!

You immmediately start growing...not the incredible Hulk, clothes-ripping growing, but the Attack of the 50 foot Woman-your-clothes-expand-as-you-do type of growth! You look down at the other students, who to you have become the size of toys!

You reach down and pluck the bully from the ground, and you lift him into the air as easily as if he had been a raisin. Now, what should you do? Teach him a lesson? Or just scare him?
1211.title: Gigantic Girl

12111.content:
You lift the bully up to eye level and glare at him angrily. You notice that he's trembling in fear.
         "So..." you say slowly, dangerously. "You like picking on people who are littler than you, do you?"
         "N... n... no, ma'am!" he stammers out.
         You look at him in disgust. "Let's see how you like it when the tables are turned, scumbag."
         You pinch the back of his pants between two of your fingers, then lift upward oh-so-slightly. The bully screams in agony as you give him a wedgie like the world has never seen before.
         You set him down roughly on the ground. "If I ever find you beating anyone up again, I won't just give you a wedgie. Consider yourself warned, creep."
12111.title: Payback

12112.content: You think about the movies you've seen. Which creature could be scary enough?
12112.title: Just scare him, but don't hurt him

121122.content:
You make a run for the girl, genre-savvy enough to know that you can transform whilst moving. You begin by extending a large tail from your sacrum, growing a massive amount of scales... but collapse and retract it.

You think for a bit, and realize that you have to obey the law of conservation of mass. All that mass has to come from somewhere...

You think of something more size-efficient.
121122.title: Basilisk (see Harry Potter)

1212.content:
You decide to skip school for the day and just have fun with your new ability. You peek around the corner and see a man who is walking towards you, but is about a block away. Black hair, gray business suit, dark red tie, moustache.... As you think it, your body changes.
         You wait a few moments, then casually walk out of the alley. You walk past the man.
"Good morning!" you say to the man.
"Er... good morning."
         He squints at you, shakes his head, and then walks off quickly. You duck back into the alley and let yourself change back to normal.
         "Neat trick." a voice behind you remarks.
         You spin around. A teenage boy is sitting on some wooden crates, smiling at you. Before you can say a word, he holds his hand out to the side and appears to concentrate. His hand begins to glow, then a thin ray of light shoots from it and makes a tiny hole in a nearby dumpster.
         "What...? How...?" you stammer.
         "I don't know. Yesterday this freak accident occurred, and I discovered that I had this new ability. I thought I was the only one, but then I met Sarah." he replies.
         "Sarah?"
         His smile widens. "Look up."
         You look up. AAAH! A girl is floating just above your head. She grins and waves at you.
         The boy continues. "We decided to join together and try to use our new gifts for good. Would you like to join us?"
1212.title: Group Mentality

choices: you learn you can go animal
12121.content:
The boy smiled. "Good. My name is Chris. Chris Smith. That's Sarah Garten. So you can change into any human shape? That might come in handy. Can you go animal at all? That would be more useful."

Slowly, as you try and strain,
12121.title: Human+Animal or No?

choices: Search for the missing girl, one Melissa Ruther
121211.content:
As slowly you concentrate, you grow claws, turning into a cat. As you turn back, Chris claps with joy and delight. A boyish expression shone on his face. “Yes! No ruffian will face down a tiger or a grizzly, that is if it’s ok with you!” You nod.
Sarah comes to a stop, or shall I say drop, and she gracefully dives in beside you. She sticks out a hand that feels light and fluttery, as if it will go flying away itself.
She smiles, face shining. “Welcome to the club.”
Chris holds up his index finger. “Oh yeah, wait, there’s two other members that I forgot to tell you about.” Out of his shirt pocket he pulled two rats. They were black, and looked grumpy, tired, and unhappy. “This is Blitz,” he gestured to the one on the left, “and this is Angelina. They had part of my burrito too. It appears to have enhanced their intelligence by a lot…
“We were always this smart,” said Blitz grumpily, “it’s not our fault that you were too stupid to teach it to us. I mean, we don’t have no Rosetta Stone program or nothing. How else would we learn it?”
Blitz yawned right in Chris’s face and went to sleep. He grinned apologetically. “Sorry, they’re a bit grumpy about being stuffed in my shirt pocket. Angelina screeched,
“And maybe I’m a bit grumpy that up until two hours ago you thought I was an ‘Angelo!’” He blushed. “The shelter said you were a neutered male, what else was I supposed to think?”
He cleared his throat, coughing. “Now you two, how about we get back to business.”
“Tomorrow, since we’ll be out for spring break, I was thinking that we should spend the whole time together fighting some crime.”
Sarah looked confused. “And how are we supposed to convince our parents?”
Chris stares at you. “Now that is where she comes into the plan. You morph into a teacher saying that you’re taking us on a school-sponsored field trip or something! Then we’re out for two weeks of crime-catching. We all have positions. I, for example, am good at getting people past locked doors with my laser beams. Or, if that fails, and if it’s a gate, and not a building that we’re trying to get into, Sarah’ll fly over to the other side and open it from that way. At other times, she’ll post as an aerial guard, occasionally taking Blitz or Angelina with her. Blitz and Angelina are good at slipping through things, and are great swimmers. They are our general spies, so you won’t need to do any crawling or creeping. Since I can only laser through non-living things, you will come in handy for the real firepower battle plan. Anyway, during spring break, who should we hunt first? There are two main people, Horatio Cortez, a convicted and escaped three-times murderer and rapist, and to search for a missing girl, a five year old named Melissa Ruther.
121211.title: Battle Plan/Blitz

1212111.content:
The next day, you morphed taking them away, and so you five set out a plan to recapture Horatio Cortez. There were rumors that he was over a hundred miles away in a deserted restaurant called "Shoney's Steak & Ale" in the heart of Alexandria, Virginia. You guys don't have enough money for even one plane ticket to get from your hometown of Charlotte, North Carolina, to the closest airport, Dulles, which would still be twenty miles away. Being only thirteen, you have no car, and not enough money to rent one, (since you could rent one, turn into a license age driver, and drive it). How will you all get up there?
Chris slumped his shoulders dejectedly. “There’s almost no way we could do it! I mean you could fly there, Sarah, but flying isn’t that much faster than walking. If it takes seven hours to drive up there, it would take a really long time to walk, even to fly!” Then, he looked hopeful. “If you went horse, and Blitz, Angelina, and I rode you, then we could getter there faster! Angelina could fly for most of the time. Say the fastest horse is a Tennessee Walking horse, which has a long distance speed of seven miles per hour and it’s about three-hundred ninety-five miles…”
He sighed. “Oh, wait! My sister could drive me up! But, the car is a 4x4 pickup truck, and only two will fit. Wait, you could morph dog and sit in the back, no, that’s not safe. Sarah, you’re small, you could squeeze in somewhere, and I guess you could turn rat or something and sit in my lap. Yes, I’ve got it!” Then his face fell. “Yeah, but I’ll need a lot of your money so we can pool it together for a bribe. My sister is nice, but she won’t drive for nothing! Pay yourselves back with the reward money. I’ve heard that it’s a hundred thousand dollars! So that no one gets suspicious, though, don’t take more than a thousand dollars for profit; someone’s gotta be wondering where the money is coming from.”
You each pull out twenty or thirty dollars, and Blitz and Angelina each pulled out a five dollar bill. Chris was about to open his mouth and ask them where they got it from, but then shook his head, deciding he did not want to know or ask. Finally, he counted it all up. “One hundred dollars, that’d oughta be enough!”

Blitz and Angelina yawn quietly and fell asleep in Chriss' pocket.

"She was last seen in the forest. Where the headquarters of the gang the Morterros were hanging out."

You nod, and Sarah smiles. Suddenly, Sarah perks up, "Hey, can you transform people other than yourself?"

You shrug, not entirerly sure yourself.

12121121.content:
You pick Chris, and staring at him, you move your eyes downward, and his form also shrinks down. Focusing your eyes, imputing the information that you so desire, you slowly compute it in. A chocolate Lab with Blitz and Angelina on its back stares up at you and barks. With a grin, you change him back, but give him long flowing blond hair. "Hey," he yells, "Change me back!"
You smile and change his hair hot pink.
"Perfect."
Sarah nods, her eyes twinkling.

Sarah says seriously, "Well, I suggest then that if you change Chris, then all of us but Blitz and Angie can fly. Then, we can form an air assault. I guess that I could carry Blitz and Angie!"

You nod, and slowly you change into an enormous Golden Eagle; although a Bald eagle is bigger, you don't want to attract too much attention.

You stare at Chris, who gulps uneasily, and you change him into a magnificent (albeit smaller) Gyrfalcon. Thinking better of it, though, you change his form into that of a Perergine Falcon; in a dive, the fastest bird on earth. Gulping uneasily at the sight of their owner being turned into their natural predator, Blitz and Angela immediatly shivered and hopped onto Sarah. The five of you took off, gliding over the trees. Sarah said,

"Once we dive and attack, I'm suggesting that I go in and find the kid, whereas Chris and you can hold them off and distract them!"

You fly on, wondering what animal to change into. In a second, you know the answer.

You see three deserted cabins from 1980 when someone tried to set up a ski lodge here but deserted. These are the headquarters of the Morterros. Quickly, stealthily, Sarah lands, and without cracking a twig silently enters one of the houses. Chris lands and blows a giant hole through the houses. The gang members all runout. Slowly, you curve up your body, until it is a very angry grizzly bear that eyes the gang members. With a roar, you rush and attack the gang members. Suddenly, one of them trips you and holds a gun in between your eyes. A loud chomping noise and one of the gang members' fingers falls off. Blitz spat angrily, muttering, "That was disgusting!"
Blitz walked away angrily. SUddenly, you have an idea. Focusing on Blitz, he grows until he is a bit larger than a cat. He tackles a gang member and bites one of their hands. Sarah comes out, with a scared little five-year-old girl in tow. Quickly, before the sees you as a bear, you change into the more appropriate Great Dane; cuddly, but strong.

As the girl clings to your fur and cries, Sarah quickly knocks out the girl, and carries her home in her arms while flying. On the way back to the police station, jubiantly, you as a large parrot turn to Chris, who you jokingly put in the form of a hummingbird. Finally, you arrive at the station in your human forms, and get to watch the little girl being embraced by her mother and father. The reward that the police had assigned you take gladly, but when the family offers also you three politely decline.

121211211.content:
The three of you stare at the 10k reward that was meant for all of you. You each get 3k, with 1k for Blitz and Angie. You say, "Let's go shopping!"

You five head to the mall. As Sarah enters a music store, you buy the best computer in the store for yourself, along with all the extras. When you are done, you still have 1k left. As nerdy as it sounds, you put it in your savings account for college. Chris had put all of it in for college. Sarah had bought some clothes and an i-Pod, and was saving the rest for later. You stare at the mountain of rat toys, treats, and the cage that looks like a mansion that Blitz and Angelina bought. Chris smiled. "I have a great idea!" "What!" "You know what there's one million or more dollar reward for?"
"What!"

"Let's go look for Osama Bin Laden!"

"I thought he was dead, man!" You cry, flinging your hands in the air.

"Is he?" Chris said stupidly.

"Or was it some other bab guy who died?" You say sheepishly. When it comes to history, you got a F-.

"I'm in." Angie says.

121211212.title: Donate to Charity

Sarah lets out a sigh of resignation but dosn't look let down unlike some of the others.

Let's go to the police station and offer our services there!
121212.content:
You try really hard to picture yourself as a cat, figuring that it would be the easiest start.

Unlike changing to be another human form, this is incredably hard!

When you think that you have changed, you reach up with what should be your paw. Where your kitty ears should be, you feel nothing but your nicely smoothed hair.

"Hmmmmm...." you say. "I can't seem to become an animal. But I can become anything that looks like a human."

"Can we test it?" Sarah asks. "Can you look like me?"

You glance at Sarah, noting her particular looks. Concentrating, you feel your form shift into Sarah's.

"Hey, that's pretty good," Chris says.

121212.title: Be Sarah

choices: You decide to go have more fun by yourself.
You decide to find your friends from school.
12122.content: You decide to refuse. You don't know who these people are or what they really want to do with their powers. You decide to stay solo, for now at least. But, what else could you do with your new found powers? Maybe even team up with your friends from school and play a prank on the teachers... Oh, there are so many opportunities!
12122.title: Staying Solo

122.content:
"Hey, new girl! Why don't you go back where you came from?"
         "Yeah, we don't need your kind here, new girl!"
         You bow your head and keep walking, ignoring the morons in the hall. Because of your dad's job, your family has moved every year or so for as long as you can remember. By now, you've become used to being made fun of.
         "Oh, too good to talk to us, are you, new girl?"
         Some jerk sticks out his foot to trip you. You see it, but react just a second too late. Roars of laughter erupt from all sides as you lose your balance and fall towards the ground, face-first. You brace yourself for the impact...
         ...but it doesn't come. Startled, you look around and find that you're hanging in midair, about an inch off the ground.
122.title: First Day of School

123.content:
You're walking to school one day, when suddenly...
         "STOP! My dog!"
         Startled, your head snaps to the left, where you see a horrible thing about to happen:
         A little puppy is out in the road, standing frozen with fear. A minivan is bearing down on it at high speed. A little boy runs out and stands in front of the puppy, waving his arms above his head and yelling to get the driver's attention. But that van will never be able to stop in time....
         You take in this whole scene in mere seconds, then before you can even think you run out and stand in front of the boy.
         SCREEEEEE-
         Fear makes everything seem to be moving in slow motion, turning it all into a nightmare slideshow of panic.
         The van's driver cranks the wheel sharply to the right, but the van tips up on two wheels and keeps coming straight at you...
         The boy starts screaming behind you...
         The puppy whimpers in terror...
         At the last instant, everything seems to glow blue. You shut your eyes tightly, and then...
         KER-SMASH!
123.title: The End?

1231.content:
You count to 5, then slowly open your eyes to a truly incredible sight.
         The van sits a couple feet in front of you, totally destroyed. Huge cracks spider-web across the windshield and the hood is crumpled like a wadded up piece of paper. After a few seconds, the driver stumbles from the wreckage and shuffles over to a nearby payphone.
         What in the world...? you wonder.
         You stare at the van for a few seconds, then slowly turn and check on the boy.
         "Are you okay?" you ask him slowly.
         He stares at the van, wide-eyed, then quickly nods. He is trembling violently and clutching the puppy to his side.
1231.title: A Smashing Good Time

12311.content:
"It's gonna be okay. Come on, let's go home." You hold out your hand to him.
         After a moment, he stands and takes your hand.
         "Where do you live?" you ask him.
         He points to a blue house on the side of the road, and you walk him safely to his front door. He looks up at you gratefully, then quickly runs inside, still holding his puppy.
12311.title: A Small Gesture of Kindness

123111.content:
You go home to find your parents, and your two older sisters watching the news. "Hey guys, whatch doing?" you ask, before looking at the T.V. You gasp to see that there is footage of yourself standing infront of the van, with a blue force feild around yourself, and the boy with the puppy. You gape at the site, and your family turns to face you. "What is this?" your mom asks.

Do you...
123111.title: Family

choices: Stick around and explain what happened.
12312.content:
There seems to be a huge dent in the grill of the van. It is almost as if the van ran into a huge boulder.

The driver doesn't seem to be hurt. He does, however, seem to be in shock.

While talking on the phone across the street, he throws you several frightened and confused glances.

The kid also seems to have faired the accident fine. How he did that is beyond you, since you were the only thing between him and the van.

Oh! Yeah! Yourself! You glance down, and see that there isn't a scratch on you! But how is that possible? You wonder to yourself. That van hit me straight on. I don't even remember feeling the impact.

The driver hangs up the phone and walks back over, seeming half shocked, as well as halfway smug.

"I called the police," he said. "They should be here any minute."

"That's good," you say.

"Good?!?" he laughs, mockingly, "Why is it good that they're going to take you to prison to figure out what kind of weapon you have on you?"

"Wha-?" you ask.

"I hit you at about 35 mph. There's not a scratch on you, and my van is totaled. Don't tell me that you didn't use a weapon, girlie."

"They're coming to arrest me?" you ask.

"Yessir."
12312.title: Police

choices: Use your forcefield on the police and escape
Use your forcefield on the bums and escape
123121.content:
You cast one look at the driver and one look at the boy with the puppy, then before you know it, you start running in the other direction, with the man shouting behind you.

You run for a quarter of an hour until you become completely sure that nobody's following you.
You stop and look around. You're in a new neighborhood now, which you don't seem to recognize. The sky is getting dark and you have no idea where you are or how to get home.

You sit down covering your face in your hands and try to think about what had happened earlier. You had stopped the van, and nearly destroyed it, but there was not a scratch on you.

"How in the world could something like this happen?" you say to yourself.

Then you remember having seen everything blue, which was strange enough in itself.

"Where had that blue light come from?" you think to yourself. Something in your head says, 'From you of course', but you quickly shake your head trying to think logically.

Then, to clear the doubt, you decide to try to create the same blue light.
You hold up your hands in front of you and try to focus and suddenly, to your great amazement, you see a small blue sphere in between your hands. You scream and the sphere disappears. You take a deep breath and try it again. And this time from the corner of your eyes you see flashing blue lights.

Oh no! The cops! They have found you. Then you see two cops get out of the car with flashlights, and coming into the dark alley.

You look the other way and see some bums coming toward you, either to mug you or kidnap you.

You're trapped!
123121.title: Trapped

choices: Use your powers to climb up onto the roofs and escape
1231212.content:
You ready yourself, edging closer to the bums. I'll jump the one that's in front first, and then...
         As you're making your plans, you overhear the bums talking.
         "Hey - check it out! This one's got half a pizza in it!" the closest of the bums exclaims. He ecstatically lifts a greasy pizza box out of the dumpster, then is instantly jumped by his other two companions
         "No way!"
         "Gimme!"
         Huh. I guess these guys haven't noticed me yet... you think, sighing in relief. They aren't out to get me. I've got to get a grip on my wild imagination!
         "-saw her run this way. Hurry!"
         You glance back towards the cops. The lights are moving closer fast. All the same, they're being careful to shine their flashlights off to the sides periodically to check the shadows - it doesn't seem like you'll be able to hide.
         The bums seem pretty distracted. They might not even notice if I ran past them...
1231212.title: On the Brink of Violence

choices: Take your chances with the strange odorous trio
12312121.content:
They seem pretty distracted, you realize - so what is the big risk if you just bolt right past them, and find your way out of this freaky neighborhood? With the sirens coming from somewhere in the distance, you run through the alley, passing by the bickering vagrants as they rummage through the dumpster.

But as you run through the trio, a strong-smelling man with a tinfoil hat and an old, Velcro-like suit blocks your passage with a freakishly flexible arm. The other companions chuckle, eating the trash pizza and amused that you thought you could stealth your way past them. In a panic, you lift up your palms to blast them all with an energy sphere but nothing happens. There is a tiny blue flicker that appears and dies before anything can happen.

"First day using your powers, girl?"
Tinfoil Hat chuckles. "Those sirens must be for you too."

"She ended up here on her first day too. Tough break!" One of the other men says.

"P-please, I don't want to hurt anyone!" You plea, remembering the blast damage on the front of the car. If that same power was used on a person... it could get messy. This empty threat makes all three men laugh.

"She has no idea where she is, boss."

"How did she get passage through here anyway?
Pretty impressive for a newbie."

The sirens are starting to sound louder and even more concerning, you also hear what sounds like a chopper whirring towards your direction.
Could all this really be for you and your little dent in the car? Something seems strange about all this, and maybe it has more to do with your new ability.

"They're coming for her. What do we do?"

Tinfoil Hat looks at you with an interest that you are unsure to be concerned by. "She chooses. Keep running or stay here, where it is safe. What'll it be, girl?"
12312121.title: In a rough neighborhood

123121212.content:
Tinfoil sighs with disappointment. How could he expect you to stay? Wherever this is: a neighborhood that is more of a dark pit that smells like sewage with its roaming transients. Could these street folk be like you?

"Don't ever pass through here if they're chasing you!" One of the hobos cries out. You don't even pause to think about it. You have to leave this place - and head where exactly? That is uncertain, you just have a choice of home or through another one of these spaces. Whatever they are...

"We'll see you around, sunshine."

You shove your way past the trio's presence and head towards the other end - the exit that leads out of this bizarro, claustrophobic alley. The helicopter above and the sirens are becoming deafening but they still seem like they're in the background.

Now that you're not near the hobos, you try again: you focus and charge up a sphere of blue light easily this time.

It makes sense - it isn't just to attack or to defend yourself, you can travel with your power, covering spans of distance and maybe even time & space. You just don't get to pick where you go.
123121212.title: Keep running

12312122.content:
If I can make a shield around myself and a little floating sphere, then maybe I can make something bigger? You focus on the idea of a ladder, then smile as a glowing blue ladder appears floating in midair. Before you can start climbing, however...
         "There she is! Stop running!"
         That's a great idea, genius, you think belatedly. Let's make a glowing blue force field while we're hiding in the shadows! That surely won't backfire!
         You hurriedly try to climb up the rungs of the ladder, but before you make much headway the cops dash over and grab you.
         "Let me go!" you shout as the cops manhandle your arms behind your back and slap some cuffs on you.
         "We're taking you in for questioning, young lady!" one of the policemen says as he leads you towards the patrol car.
12312122.title: An Unfortunate Moment of Brilliance

123122.content: But officer i didn't do it. Sure you didnt little lady. All the sudden I ran in front of the van and a miraculous thing happened. I saw blue felt the pressure of the van hit me and suddenly its remains were behind me and I was perfectly fine. You should arrest this guy for nearly killing me.
123122.title: But officer

1231222.content:
The officer examines you carefully and smiles. He notes how you are entirely unarmed, unharmed, and are clearly not of the build to stop a car with your hands. His associates asked for witnesses, and the driver given a court order for reckless driving. You, however, were taken into a large vehicle. It seems you are going to prison anyways.

"Katie Smith?" An officer in the vehicle, armed, looked to you.

"I told you, I didn't do anything!" you shouted in a panic.

"We know" Come to think of it, they didn't cuff you or anything. "We just want answers."

You calmed down slightly. "What is it?" you asked, still shaky from the situation.

"Have you come in contact with a silver mouse recently?" Come to think of it, there was a small mouse that you found in your cabinet recently. He panicked, he bit you, and days later he fell victim to a glue trap. You answered yes and he placed his hand on his chin. "The virulent was roughly based on the rodent lyssavirus..."

"What? Virus!?" and you panicked once more.

"It was experimental, designed to increase mental strength"

"What are you saying?" A cold sweat dripped down your jawline. You remembered how since then, your grades and reaction time have improved. Your eyesight even improved slightly. "What does this have to do with the accident!?"

His answer was quickly drawing his pistol and firing. You lifted your arms, closed your eyes, and screamed.

The bullet fell to the floor, crushed on impact.

"What's happening?" Adrenaline pumped through your blood, fear coursing through your nerves.

"We're almost at the station. We'll explain everything."
1231222.title: Officer is impressed

124.content:
It all started as a pretty uneventful evening. You ate a couple slices of pizza, then drove to your job at Stop & Go, a small convenience store/gas station on the outskirts of town. You locked your car doors, relieved the person behind the counter, and settled in for a long, uneventful shift.
         Right after sunset, a man in a sweatshirt had filled his jeep up with gas and come inside to pay for it.
         "$25 of gas?" you ask him.
         "Yeah..." he'd replied, "and while you're at it, give me all of the money in the cash register."
         What in the world? you thought. Is this guy trying to rob me?
         The man pulls a pistol out of his pocket and levels it at your head. "Move it!"
         You fill up a bag with cash from the cash register, surreptitiously setting off the silent alarm in the process. The police will be here in a few minutes... you think. If I can just stall this guy until they get here....
         "Uh... I don't have very much money here in the register, but there's a safe in the back that I can open for you if you like..." you offer.
         The man squints at you suspiciously, then slowly nods. "Alright... take me to it."
124.title: Inconvenience Store

1241.content:
You lead the man into the back, to a strongbox that holds all of the money that's been taken in during the past 3 days. I have to buy more time....
         "Now where did I put that key? I know it was around here somewhere..." you mutter, putting on a big show of "searching" for the key. After a few seconds, the man gets impatient.
         "You're just trying to stall me until the cops get here, aren't you?! You probably pushed some sort of silent alarm, and now you're just wasting time, right?!" he shouts angrily.
         "No... no, that's not what I'm doing!" you stammer.
         "Oh, I think it is. Say goodnight, girl!"
         The man points the gun at your forehead and squeezes the trigger. You shut your eyes.
         BLAM!
         CLANG!
         Your head snaps back with the impact, but you don't feel any pain. That's odd... it doesn't hurt at all.
         "What the...?"
         You open your eyes and see the man stumbling backwards, away from you. He aims the gun again and squeezes off two rounds.
         BLAM!
         BLAM!
         Tink!
         Pa-ching!
         You stagger back a step and thrust your arms in front of you. He shot me... but it didn't even hurt! you marvel.
         "Aaaah! Get away from me, you freak!"
         The man turns and sprints away from you. He bumps into a stack of pop bottles, knocks over a magazine rack, and finally smacks his head on one of the metal shelves. He collapses on the ground, knocked out cold.
         You run to the man and shake him, trying to see if he's okay. Suddenly, you notice something odd about your outstretched arm. It almost looks like... metal?
         You stand up straight and look down at your body... and see that it's turned into solid metal!
         "Aaah!" you scream, and notice that even your voice has a slight metallic ring to it.
         "What's happened to me? How do I undo it?"
         Even as you ask, your body changes back to normal. Can I change into metal just by trying? you wonder.
         You test out your theory, changing back and forth. Metal. Normal. Metal. Normal.
         "Ha ha! Sweet!" you exclaim.
         "What's sweet?"
         You spin around and see that the cops are here.
         "Holy crow!"
One of the cops spots the thug on the ground. He walks over and examines him more closely, then looks up at you.
         "What happened?"
         You tell him how the man tried to rob you, but then got impatient, panicked, and ended up knocking himself out.
         The cops handcuff the thief and toss him into the back of their car, then drive off. You clean up the store, lock it up for the night, and get into your car.
         Maybe I should go somewhere quiet and clear my head....
1241.title: Not Exactly What You Had Planned, But...

12411.content:
At home, you lie down on the couch and sigh. This was emotionally exhausting. Thankfully the cops believed you when you explained what the crook did to himself.

Whatever. Some kind of phlebotinum whatever just gave you the power of metal-shifting. Sweet.

You take some time to find out how to turn only body parts into metal. You then tap your knuckle against your forearm, feeling that it is definitely not hollow. From what you can tell, it is reflex-activated. Enough focus allowed full control. Thankfully, your anatomy class will help you shift bones to metal without anything further. You also took note of how your limbs become heavier when steeled, defying the law of conservation of mass.

You have no clue how else it works, but you did have fun placing some magnets on your steeled limbs.

Where to next...?
12411.title: Drive home

12412.content:
As you drive out of the city, it starts raining. First it's just a few drops, but it quickly turns into a downpour. You can barely see ten feet ahead of you.
         Maybe I should turn back. It's kind of dangerous to-
         Suddenly, a deer runs out into the road right in front of you!
         "AAAAH!" you scream, yanking the steering wheel to the side and stomping the brakes.
         Screeee-
         Your car slides off the road and rockets toward some trees.
         Oh no... you think, shutting your eyes tightly.
12412.title: Dangerous Driving

info.brief_description: You have suddenly acquired super powers! What will you do with them?
info.description: In this interactive story you will get a chance to be a superhero!
